[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: LEDGER_INFO_CF_NAME + EPOCH_BY_VERSION_CF_NAME] [Epoch-ledger consistency] Can ledger info point to invalid epochs (via EPOCH_BY_VERSION_CF_NAME), causing validators to apply wrong validator sets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: EVENT_ACCUMULATOR_CF_NAME + EVENT_CF_NAME] [Event-accumulator sync] Is the event accumulator (EVENT_ACCUMULATOR_CF_NAME) updated atomically with event insertion (EVENT_CF_NAME), or can accumulator be inconsistent? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: BLOCK_INFO_CF_NAME + BLOCK_BY_VERSION_CF_NAME] [Block metadata sync] Can block info and block-version mappings become desynchronized, causing queries to return wrong block information? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Type safety bypass] Can raw byte manipulation bypass schema type safety (e.g., writing Version as u64 but reading as u32), causing data corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Function: ensure_slice_len_eq()] [Endianness issues] Does ensure_slice_len_eq account for endianness in multi-byte values, or can big-endian/little-endian confusion cause validation to pass with wrong data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Padding attacks] Can attackers pad data with extra bytes that pass length checks but cause deserialization to read beyond intended boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants + BCS] [BCS enumeration] For enums serialized via BCS, can invalid discriminant values pass length checks causing crashes or undefined behavior during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: TRANSACTION_ACCUMULATOR_HASH_CF_NAME] [Hash validation] Are accumulator hashes validated against recomputed values before use, or can corrupted hashes in TRANSACTION_ACCUMULATOR_HASH_CF_NAME cause invalid state commitments? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: JELLYFISH_MERKLE_NODE_CF_NAME] [Merkle proof verification] Do all Merkle tree operations verify cryptographic proofs, or can attackers insert fake nodes into JELLYFISH_MERKLE_NODE_CF_NAME? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: LEDGER_INFO_CF_NAME] [Signature verification] Is ledger info signature verification performed before storing in LEDGER_INFO_CF_NAME, or can unsigned/invalid ledger info corrupt consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME] [Hash function strength] What hash function is used for state key hashing, and is it collision-resistant enough to prevent preimage attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: Line 38-69] [Constant modification] Are column family name constants protected from modification, or can they be changed at runtime causing schema confusion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: ColumnFamilyName type] [Type safety] Is ColumnFamilyName a strongly-typed wrapper preventing string literals from being used directly, or can string confusion allow wrong column families to be accessed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: Line 38-69] [Naming conventions] Do column family names follow consistent naming conventions that prevent confusion between similar entities (e.g., TRANSACTION vs TRANSACTION_INFO)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Use statements: Line 35-36] [Dependency injection] Can malicious code replace anyhow::ensure or aptos_schemadb imports with compromised versions, bypassing validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STALE_NODE_INDEX_CF_NAME + STALE_STATE_VALUE_INDEX_CF_NAME] [Pruning atomicity] Is pruning of stale nodes and state values atomic across both indexes, or can partial pruning leave dangling references? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STALE_NODE_INDEX_CROSS_EPOCH_CF_NAME] [Epoch pruning safety] During cross-epoch pruning, are epoch boundaries properly validated to prevent pruning nodes needed for current epoch state proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STALE_STATE_VALUE_INDEX_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME] [Key hash pruning] When pruning by key hash, is full key verification performed to prevent incorrect pruning of values with hash collisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Pruning window validation] Are pruning windows validated to ensure required historical data for state sync and proofs isn't deleted prematurely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: ORDERED_TRANSACTION_BY_ACCOUNT_CF_NAME + TRANSACTION_SUMMARIES_BY_ACCOUNT_CF_NAME] [Query consistency] Can API queries return inconsistent results if ORDERED_TRANSACTION_BY_ACCOUNT_CF_NAME and TRANSACTION_SUMMARIES_BY_ACCOUNT_CF_NAME are out of sync? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: TRANSACTION_BY_HASH_CF_NAME] [Hash lookup vulnerability] Can hash lookup via TRANSACTION_BY_HASH_CF_NAME be manipulated to return wrong transaction versions, causing applications to execute incorrect transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STATE_VALUE_CF_NAME + STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME] [State query race] Can concurrent state queries via different indexes (full key vs hash) return different values during updates, violating linearizability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: EVENT_BY_KEY_CF_NAME + EVENT_BY_VERSION_CF_NAME] [Event query consistency] Do event queries by key vs by version return consistent event sets, or can indexing bugs cause events to appear in one index but not the other? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STATE_VALUE_CF_NAME + HOT_STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME] [Hot/cold sharding] Is data migration between hot (HOT_STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME) and cold (STATE_VALUE_CF_NAME) storage atomic, preventing data loss during migration? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Shard distribution] If column families are distributed across multiple RocksDB instances, are cross-shard transactions properly coordinated with two-phase commit? (Critical)
